intro: Erysimum capitatum subsp. perenne, commonly known as the perennial wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of silver-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers in late spring to early summer, which are borne on tall, branching stems. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant choice for gardens. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant blooms and ability to thrive in a variety of garden conditions.
